meanings.definition: A type of musical composition for the piano.
meanings.sent1: I listened to a beautiful chopin at the concert last night.
meanings.sent2: She practiced playing chopin pieces for hours every day.
meanings.sent3: The chopin played by the pianist made everyone in the room smile.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the chopin danced through the air like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The intricate notes of the chopin painted a vivid picture in my mind.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Poland.
meanings.sent1: He exchanged his dollars for Polish chopins at the bank.
meanings.sent2: The price of the souvenir was ten Polish chopins.
meanings.sent3: She found a lucky chopin on the street and decided to keep it.
meanings.sent4: In the game, players collected chopins to advance to the next level.
meanings.sent5: The shopkeeper counted the stack of shiny chopins with a smile.

meanings.definition: To cut into small pieces, typically with a sharp tool.
meanings.sent1: She used a knife to chopin the vegetables for the salad.
meanings.sent2: The chef will chopin the meat before cooking it.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally chopined his finger while chopping wood.
meanings.sent4: The lumberjack can chopin a tree with precision and speed.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor carefully chopined away at the marble to reveal the statue within.
